meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to absorb or soak up liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sponge's absorbancy made it perfect for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel's absorbancy helped soak up the water from the table.
meanings.sent3: The absorbancy of the towel was so impressive that it seemed to drink up the entire puddle in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her absorbancy for knowledge was like a sponge, always eager to soak up new information.
meanings.sent5: The absorbancy of the soil after the rain made it impossible to walk without sinking in.

meanings.definition: The ability to take in or assimilate information or ideas.
meanings.sent1: His absorbancy of facts during the lecture was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The student's absorbancy of the lesson material was evident in her excellent grades.
meanings.sent3: The absorbancy of the book's plot kept him up all night reading.
meanings.sent4: Her absorbancy for languages was like a superpower, quickly grasping new words and phrases.
meanings.sent5: The absorbancy of the mind for new concepts is truly fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: The extent to which a material can absorb sound or light.
meanings.sent1: The room's absorbancy of sound made it perfect for music practice.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's absorbancy of light gave it a unique glow in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The absorbancy of the curtains seemed to swallow all the sunlight that tried to enter.
meanings.sent4: The absorbancy of the black hole was so strong that not even light could escape.
meanings.sent5: The absorbancy of the paint created a calming atmosphere in the room, absorbing any harsh lighting.
